tool.name: @EXECUTABLE@
tool.description: predicts RNA secondary structures including pseudoknots
tool.command: RNAplfold < '$input' -T$temperature --dangles=$dangling --cutoff=$cutoff --winsize=$winsize --span=$span $onthefly $openingenergies #if $varExists('$unpairedOption.ulength') --ulength=$unpairedOption.ulength #end if #if $varExists('$advancedOptions.nolp') $advancedOptions.noconversion $advancedOptions.nolp $advancedOptions.nogu $advancedOptions.noclosinggu $advancedOptions.notetra #end if && find -name '*_basepairs' -or -name '*_lunp' -or -name '*_openen*' > files.tmp && tar -cf '$outputf' --files-from=files.tmp

param.name: dangling
param.label: how to treat dangling end energies
param.option: unpaired bases participate in all dangling ends (2)
unpaired bases participate in one dangling end only (1)

param.name: winsize
param.label: Average pairing probabilities over this windowsize

param.name: cutoff
param.label: Cutoff probability for report on base pairing

param.name: onthefly
param.label: Print simplified base pair probabilities (_basepairs output)

param.name: openingenergies
param.label: Output in logarithm of the probabilities (_openen output)

param.name: unpairedSelector
param.label: Compute probabilty that region is unpaired (_lunp output)

param.name: noclosinggu
param.label: Allow GU pairing at the ends
param.help: Allow pairing of G and U at the ends of helices. --noClosingGU

param.name: notetra
param.label: Allow stabilization for loops, hairpins etc.
param.help: Include special tabulated stabilizing energies for tri-, tetra- and hexaloop hairpins. Mostly for testing. (--noTetra)

tool.help:
**RNAplfold**
Computes local pair probabilities for base pairs with a maximal span of L. The probabilities are averaged over all windows of size L that contain the base pair. For a sequence of length n and a window size of L the algorithm uses only O(n+L*L) memory and O(n*L*L) CPU time. Thus it is practical to "scan" very large genomes for short stable RNA structures.
-----
**Input format**
RNAPplfold requires one input file
- Fasta file
------
**Outputs**
For each structure in the Fasta input a postscript image with dot-plot of the pairing probabilities is generated. Different output is generated with the "--ulength", "--print_onthefly" and "--opening_energies" flags. The Dot Plot Matrices are stored in a Postscript file. The other output is packed in a tar file.
